channel.title: Favorite bone
channel.description:
Mine's the jawbone. The jaw has a loose degree of freedom but is also anchored at both ends giving it a lot of sturdiness.
It's also representative of what I'll term [i]a meso-skeletal structure[/i]... We do not have exoskeletons, but the ribs and skull don't function as rods hugged by meat. The ribs and skull serve as protective shells (the way an exoskeleton does), coated for the mostpart with a basic regenerative layer of skin. As they are neither [i]exoskeleton[/i] nor stricly [i]endoskeleton[/i], I say [i][url=https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/meso-]meso[/url]skeleton[/i].
The jaw serves as a mesoskeletal joint and is the closest thing we have to a lobster's hinges. And I have seen someone online describe the anatomy of xenomorphs as mesoskeletal, so we know it's the kind of thing that a tough higher-species is made of.
[b]Edit:[/b] Oh shit, this page didn't used to come up on Google results for the term, but now I know that it exists for-realsies: [url]https://thebigdictionary.com/mesoskeleton/[/url]

item.title: Favorite bone
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
bur:

i just dont see how one can prefer one bone over another

There’s a wide number of bones to pick from, and there are many ways to observe them in a way you find pleasant or meaningful (for instance: shape, arrangement, purpose, social impact).

It’s the same as having a favorite color, a favorite car, a favorite animal or favorite skyscraper. The only difference is that your favorite bone is less likely to have its own cartoon character than your favorite animal is to.

bur:

hey im not saying you’re wrong to like bones, im just saying i dont

Why’d you have to fracture that beautiful combo :[

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite bone
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
What kind of amazing world do you live in where you can say that with confidence?
What do you have that’s better than the curvaceous, tantalizing practicality that is bones?

Bones are so cool that people who already have them get them permanently drawn onto their skin, in addition to printing them on their clothing.
ever hear of a skull? Shit’s off the chain

Read full topic

item.description:
I met a guy who used to paint the skulls of celebrities and ‘normal’ people. I’m not entirely sure how he did it or what it looked like, but he made a fair amount of cash from it. He sold ten paintings for £20,000.

Bastard.
